summary: This document is an email chain from December 2020 discussing the approval process for a new client seeking therapy as a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves FBI Victim Services Division personnel and a licensed psychotherapist in Florida coordinating the start of treatment.

persons.name: M.S.
persons.context: A licensed mental health counselor certified in sexual abuse trauma in Greenacres, Florida, who will begin providing therapy to a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', identified as the perpetrator of the victimization for which the new client is seeking therapy.

connections.description: M.S. is providing therapy to a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse.

events.title: Scheduled therapy session for Epstein victim
events.description: A licensed psychotherapist schedules to begin treatment for a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was involved in approving and coordinating therapy for a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein in late 2020.
A licensed psychotherapist in Greenacres, Florida, was scheduled to begin treatment for the victim on December 8, 2020.
Internal FBI emails show a process requiring confirmation that an individual is a 'confirmed victim' before approving treatment services.
The correspondence indicates ongoing victim support efforts related to the Epstein case years after his death.
